title: AirPods Pro
content:
{{Short description|Wireless earbuds produced by Apple}} {{Use mdy dates|date=February 2018}} {{Infobox information appliance | name = AirPods Pro | logo = AirPods_Pro.svg | image = AirPods Pro (2nd generation).jpg | caption = Units and charging case of second-generation AirPods Pro | image_size = 250px | developer = [[Apple Inc.]] | family = AirPods | type = [[Headset (audio)#Bluetooth|Wireless]] [[Headphones#In-ear headphones|in-ear headphones]] | releasedate = {{Plainlist| *'''1st gen''': {{Start date and age|2019|10|30}} *'''2nd gen / 2nd gen (USB-C)''': {{Start date and age|2022|9|23}} }}{{Start date and age|2023|9|22}} | baseprice = {{hlist|US$249.00}} | units sold = | soc = {{Plainlist| *'''1st gen''': [[Apple silicon#Apple H1|Apple H1]] *'''2nd gen / 2nd gen (Refresh)''': [[Apple silicon#Apple H2|Apple H2]] (AirPods), [[Apple_silicon#Apple_U1|U1]] (charging case) Lossless Audio Support (2nd gen USB-C only) }} | discontinued = {{Start date|2022|9|7}} (1st generation) | input = '''AirPods''' {{small|(each)}}
Dual beam-forming microphones, dual optical sensors, [[Accelerometer#Motion input|accelerometer]] | connectivity = '''AirPods''' {{small|(each)}}
[[Bluetooth#Bluetooth_5|Bluetooth 5]] (1st generation)
[[Bluetooth#Bluetooth_5.3|Bluetooth 5.3]] (2nd generation)
5 GHz radio (2nd generation SKUs after September 22, 2023)
'''Charging case'''
[[Lightning (connector)|Lightning]] port (1st generation, 2nd generation SKUs before September 22, 2023)
[[USB-C]] port (2nd generation SKUs after September 22, 2023)
[[Qi (standard)|Qi]]
[[MagSafe (smartphones)|MagSafe]] (1st-generation SKUs after October 2021, 2nd generation)
[[Apple Watch]] charger (2nd generation)
[[Ultra-wideband]] (2nd generation) | currentfw = '''1st gen''': 6A300{{cite web | url=https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT213317 | title=About firmware updates for AirPods | access-date=September 12, 2022 | archive-date=January 9, 2023 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230109153323/https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT213317 | url-status=live }} (September 18, 2023)
'''2nd gen''': 6B34 (USB-C) 6B34 (Lightning){{cite web | url=https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT213317 | title=About firmware updates for AirPods | access-date=September 12, 2022 | archive-date=January 9, 2023 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230109153323/https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT213317 | url-status=live }} (December 5, 2023) | dimensions = '''AirPods:''' {{small|(each)}}
0.86 x 0.94 x 1.22 in
(21.8 x 24 x 30.9 mm)
'''Charging case:'''
1.78 x 0.85 x 2.39 in
(45.2 x 21.7 x 60.6 mm) | weight = '''AirPods''' {{small|(each)}}
0.19 ounces (5.4 g)
'''Charging case'''
1.61 ounces (45.6 g) | website = [https://apple.com/airpods-pro apple.com/airpods-pro] | manufacturer = [[Luxshare]] ([[contract manufacturer|on contract]]) }} '''AirPods Pro''' are wireless [[Bluetooth]] [[Headphones#In-ear headphones|in-ear headphones]] designed by [[Apple Inc.|Apple]], initially introduced on October 30, 2019.{{Cite web|url=https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2019/10/apple-announces-airpods-pro/|title=Apple announces AirPods Pro|work=[[Ars Technica]]|last=Axon|first=Samuel|date=28 October 2019|access-date=28 October 2019|archive-date=January 14, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200114184256/https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2019/10/apple-announces-airpods-pro/|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2019/10/28/20936454/apple-airpods-pro-new-release-date-price-noise-cancellation-design-immersive-sound|title=Apple announces AirPods Pro with noise cancellation, coming October 30th|work=[[The Verge]]|last=Welch|first=Chris|date=28 October 2019|access-date=28 October 2019|archive-date=December 13, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191213220704/https://www.theverge.com/2019/10/28/20936454/apple-airpods-pro-new-release-date-price-noise-cancellation-design-immersive-sound|url-status=live}} They are Apple's mid-range wireless headphones, they are available alongside the base-level [[AirPods]] and the highest-end [[AirPods Max]]. The first-generation AirPods Pro use the [[Apple silicon#Apple H1|H1 chip]], also found in the second-generation AirPods. Notable additions include [[active noise cancellation]], transparency mode, automated [[Equalization (audio)|frequency profile]] adjustment, [[IPX4]] water resistance, a charging case supporting [[wireless charging]], and interchangeable silicone ear tips.{{cite web|title=AirPods Pro|url=https://www.apple.com/airpods-pro/|website=Apple|language=en-US|access-date=2019-10-29|archive-date=October 29, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191029030035/https://www.apple.com/airpods-pro/|url-status=live}} In September 2022, Apple announced the second-generation AirPods Pro. The newer iteration incorporates the [[Apple silicon#Apple H2|H2 chip]], [[Bluetooth 5.3]] connectivity, improved sound quality and noise cancellation capabilities, an extended battery life, volume adjusting gestures, support [[Find My]] tracking, provide compatibility with [[Apple Watch]] chargers, and extra-small sized ear tips. A revision in 2023 added [[IP code|IP54]] dust resistance, support for [[lossless audio]] in conjunction with the [[Apple Vision Pro]], and a [[USB-C]] charging case. ==Models== === First generation === Apple announced AirPods Pro on October 28, 2019, and released them two days later on October 30, 2019. They include features of standard [[AirPods]], such as a microphone that filters out [[background noise]], [[accelerometer|accelerometers]] and optical sensors that can detect presses on the stem and in-ear placement, and automatic pausing when they are taken out of the ears. Control by tapping is replaced by pressing a force sensor on the stems.{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnet.com/how-to/9-cool-airpods-pro-tips-and-tricks-to-try-with-your-new-earbuds/|title=The 9 new AirPods Pro tricks you need to master now|last=Cipriani|first=Jason|website=CNET|language=en|access-date=2019-11-03|archive-date=November 3, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191103151350/https://www.cnet.com/how-to/9-cool-airpods-pro-tips-and-tricks-to-try-with-your-new-earbuds/|url-status=live}} They are rated [[IP Code|IPX4]] for water resistance.{{Cite web|title=AirPods Pro - Technical Specifications|url=https://www.apple.com/airpods-pro/specs/|access-date=2019-10-29|website=Apple|language=en-US|archive-date=October 29, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191029005701/https://www.apple.com/airpods-pro/specs/|url-status=live}} The AirPods Pro use the [[Apple silicon#Apple H1|H1 chip]] also found in the second and third-generation AirPods, that supports hands-free "Hey [[Siri]]". They have [[active noise cancellation]], accomplished by microphones detecting outside sound and speakers producing precisely opposite "anti-noise". Active noise cancellation can be turned off or switched to "transparency mode" that helps users hear surroundings. Noise cancellation modes can also be switched in iOS or by pinching the stems of the AirPods using the force sensor.{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnet.com/news/airpods-pro-are-249-might-actually-fit-in-your-ears-and-available-oct-30/|title=AirPods Pro are $249, might actually fit in your ears and available Oct. 30|last=Mihalcik|first=Carrie|work=[[CNET]]|language=en|access-date=2019-10-29|archive-date=October 29, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191029071436/https://www.cnet.com/news/airpods-pro-are-249-might-actually-fit-in-your-ears-and-available-oct-30/|url-status=live}} The H1 chip is embedded in a unique [[system in a package]] (SiP) module enclosing several other components, such as the [[Audio codec|audio processor]] and [[accelerometer]]s.{{cite web|url=https://massless.info/images/SP20471-Advanced-SiP-in-the-Apple-AirPods-Pro-Sample.pdf|title=Advanced System in Package Technology in the Apple AirPods Pro|last=Dube|first=Belinda|work=System Plus Consulting|language=en|date=2020-03-11|access-date=2021-01-06|archive-date=November 15, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20221115142427/https://massless.info/images/SP20471-Advanced-SiP-in-the-Apple-AirPods-Pro-Sample.pdf|url-status=live}} Battery life is rated to be equal to the second-generation AirPods at five hours, but noise cancellation or transparency mode reduce it to 4.5 hours due to the extra processing.{{Cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2019/10/28/20936510/apple-ios-13-2-airpods-pro-compatible|title=Apple releases iOS 13.2 with support for AirPods Pro and iPhone 11 Deep Fusion|last=Lee|first=Dami|date=2019-10-28|work=[[The Verge]]|language=en|access-date=2019-10-29|archive-date=October 29, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191029012105/https://www.theverge.com/2019/10/28/20936510/apple-ios-13-2-airpods-pro-compatible|url-status=live}} The charging case advertises the same 24 hours of total listening time as the standard AirPods case. It also features [[Qi (standard)|Qi standard]] wireless charging compatibility. In October 2021, Apple updated the bundled charging case with [[MagSafe (smartphones)|MagSafe]].{{Cite web|title=AirPods Pro Now Available With MagSafe Charging Case for Same $249 Price|url=https://www.macrumors.com/2021/10/18/airpods-pro-magsafe-charging-case/|access-date=2021-10-18|website=MacRumors|date=October 18, 2021 |language=en|archive-date=October 23, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211023142322/https://www.macrumors.com/2021/10/18/airpods-pro-magsafe-charging-case/|url-status=live}} Like AirPods, AirPods Pro have received criticism for their battery life.{{Cite web|last=Eadicicco|first=Lisa|title=Samsung is launching a new pair of wireless earbuds, and it sounds like they will have one big advantage over Apple's AirPods|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-galaxy-buds-plus-release-price-longer-battery-life-airpods-2020-2|access-date=2020-02-11|website=Business Insider|archive-date=December 25, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211225134104/https://www.businessinsider.com/samsung-galaxy-buds-plus-release-price-longer-battery-life-airpods-2020-2|url-status=live}} [[File:Apple airpods pro case.jpg|thumb|left|AirPods Pro in charging case]] AirPods Pro come with three sizes of silicone tips. There is a software test in iOS called the Ear Tip Fit Test that "[checks] the fit of your AirPods ear tips to determine which size provides the best seal and acoustic performance" to ensure a correct fit, as well as a feature called "Adaptive EQ" which automatically adjusts the [[Equalization (audio)|frequency contour]], claimed to better match the wearer's ear shape. Starting in early 2020, Apple started selling tip replacements for AirPods Pro on their website.{{Cite web|last=Statt|first=Nick|date=2020-04-15|title=Apple now sells AirPods Pro tip replacements on its website|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/15/21222930/apple-airpods-tip-replacements-for-sale-online|access-date=2020-04-16|website=The Verge|language=en|archive-date=April 16, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200416012044/https://www.theverge.com/2020/4/15/21222930/apple-airpods-tip-replacements-for-sale-online|url-status=live}} With [[iOS 14]] and [[iPadOS 14]], Apple added a [[spatial audio]] mode designed to simulate [[5.1 surround sound]]. Supported apps include the [[Apple TV (software)|Apple TV app]], [[Disney+]], [[HBO Max]] and [[Netflix]].{{Cite web|date=2020-09-16|title=Which Apple Devices and Video Services Support 'Spatial Audio' on AirPods Pro?|url=https://www.lifehacker.com.au/2020/09/which-apple-devices-and-video-services-support-spatial-audio-on-airpods-pro/|access-date=2020-09-21|website=Lifehacker Australia|language=en-AU|archive-date=December 22, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211222070800/https://www.lifehacker.com.au/2020/09/which-apple-devices-and-video-services-support-spatial-audio-on-airpods-pro/|url-status=live}}{{cite web |last1=Miller |first1=Chance |title=Netflix now rolling out Spatial Audio support on iPhone and iPad |url=http://www.9to5mac.com/2021/08/18/netflix-spatial-audio-support-roll-out/ |publisher=[[Apple community#9to5Mac|9 to 5 Mac]] |access-date=4 September 2021 |date=18 August 2021 |archive-date=September 4, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210904145330/https://9to5mac.com/2021/08/18/netflix-spatial-audio-support-roll-out/ |url-status=live }} Spatial audio requires an iPhone or iPad with an [[Apple A10]] processor or newer.{{Cite web|title=Listen with spatial audio for AirPods Pro|url=https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211775|access-date=2020-09-21|website=Apple Support|language=en|archive-date=October 3, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201003101354/https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT211775|url-status=live}} [[tvOS]] 15 brought spatial audio to the [[Apple TV]] 4K.{{Cite web|last=Espósito|first=Filipe|date=2021-06-16|title=Comment: tvOS 15 is a small update, but it brings two important new features to Apple TV|url=https://9to5mac.com/2021/06/16/comment-tvos-15-is-a-small-update-but-it-brings-two-important-new-features-to-apple-tv/|access-date=2021-06-24|website=9to5Mac|language=en-US|archive-date=December 25, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211225134105/https://9to5mac.com/2021/06/16/comment-tvos-15-is-a-small-update-but-it-brings-two-important-new-features-to-apple-tv/|url-status=live}} {{multiple image |direction=vertical |header=Illustrations of the H1 SiP |image1=Apple H1 SiP top.png |caption1=SiP from the top, showing the part containing the audio processors |image2=Apple H1 SiP bottom.png |caption2=SiP from the bottom, showing the H1 enclosure, the two accelerometers, the Bluetooth antenna connector and the large pad attaching a [[Flexible flat cable|flex cable]] to all other components in the headphone }} iOS 14 also added the ability to apply headphone accommodations to transparency mode, allowing the AirPods Pro to act as rudimentary [[Hearing Aids|hearing aids]].{{cite web |last1=Bailey |first1=Abram |title=AirPods Pro Become Hearing Aids in iOS 14 |url=https://www.hearingtracker.com/news/airpods-pro-become-hearing-aids-with-ios-14 |website=Hearing Tracker |access-date=November 24, 2020 |archive-date=January 25, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210125230743/https://www.hearingtracker.com/news/airpods-pro-become-hearing-aids-with-ios-14 |url-status=live }} In October 2021, a new Conversation Boost mode was added as a customization of the regular Transparency mode. It boosts voices above background noise and music.{{Cite web|last=Campbell|first=Ian Carlos|date=2021-10-06|title=AirPods Pro can help you hear conversations better after recent firmware update|url=https://www.theverge.com/2021/10/6/22713126/airpods-pro-conversation-boost-firmware-update|access-date=2021-10-07|website=The Verge|language=en-US|archive-date=October 7, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211007105415/https://www.theverge.com/2021/10/6/22713126/airpods-pro-conversation-boost-firmware-update|url-status=live}} === Second generation === The second-generation AirPods Pro were announced at an Apple media event on September 7, 2022, and were released on September 23, 2022. They use an updated H2 chip with [[Bluetooth#Bluetooth_5.3|Bluetooth 5.3]] connectivity, and feature improved sound quality and noise cancellation, and longer battery life. They also include extra-small sized ear tips, and AirPods support swiping up and down to adjust volume. Ear tips are physically compatible with first generation AirPods Pro as they use the same connector, but Apple notes the second generation ear tips use a less dense mesh and recommends against intermixing them for acoustical consistency.{{Cite web |title=Apple Explains Why Second-Generation AirPods Pro Ear Tips Are Incompatible With Original AirPods Pro |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2022/09/22/apple-explains-airpods-pro-ear-tips-compatibility/ |access-date=2022-09-24 |website=MacRumors |date=September 22, 2022 |language=en |archive-date=September 24, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220924172714/https://www.macrumors.com/2022/09/22/apple-explains-airpods-pro-ear-tips-compatibility/ |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |title=Apple says old and new AirPods Pro ear tips are incompatible because of mesh density |url=https://www.theverge.com/2022/9/23/23368633/apple-airpods-pro-ear-tips-incompatible-mesh |access-date=2022-09-24 |website=The Verge |date=September 23, 2022 |language=en-US |archive-date=September 24, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220924172720/https://www.theverge.com/2022/9/23/23368633/apple-airpods-pro-ear-tips-incompatible-mesh |url-status=live }} The charging case includes the [[Apple U1]] chip that supports [[Find My]] tracking, and includes a speaker for locating and status updates. In addition to [[Lightning (connector)|Lightning]], [[Qi (standard)|Qi]] and [[MagSafe (iPhone)|MagSafe]] chargers, it is also compatible with [[Apple Watch]] chargers. A [[lanyard]] loop was also added to the side of the case.{{Cite web |last=Welch |first=Chris |date=2022-09-07 |title=Apple's new AirPods Pro can cancel twice as much noise |url=https://www.theverge.com/2022/9/7/23327631/apple-airpods-pro-new-second-gen-specs-price-release-date-features |access-date=2022-09-07 |website=The Verge |language=en |archive-date=September 7, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220907174417/https://www.theverge.com/2022/9/7/23327631/apple-airpods-pro-new-second-gen-specs-price-release-date-features |url-status=live }}{{Cite web |title=Apple announces the next-generation of AirPods Pro |url=https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2022/09/apple-announces-the-next-generation-of-airpods-pro/ |access-date=2022-09-07 |website=Apple Newsroom |language=en-US |archive-date=September 7, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220907183635/https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2022/09/apple-announces-the-next-generation-of-airpods-pro/ |url-status=live }} In September 2023, Apple updated the second-generation AirPods Pro with improved [[IP code|IP54]] dust resistance, an updated H2 chip that supports the 5 GHz band for lossless audio with the [[Apple Vision Pro]], and a charging case with a [[USB-C]] port instead of a Lightning port.{{Cite web |last=Welch |first=Chris |date=2023-09-12 |title=Apple is switching the AirPods Pro charging case to USB-C |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/9/12/23860305/airpods-pro-usb-c-cases-apple-announced |access-date=2023-09-12 |website=The Verge |language=en-US}}{{Cite web |date=2023-09-22 |title=Apple Explains Why Only USB-C AirPods Pro Support Lossless Audio With Vision Pro |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2023/09/22/apple-on-airpods-pro-vision-pro-lossless-audio/ |access-date=2023-09-28 |website=MacRumors |language=en}} In iOS 17 and onwards, Apple has updated a few new functions for the second-generation model (both types of charging ports): "Adaptive Audio" dynamically blends Transparency and Active Noise Cancellation to tailor the noise control experience as the user moves between changing environments and interactions throughout the day; "Press" to answer/mute/end a call; "Personalized volume" uses machine learning to fine-tune the content enjoyment experience based on user preferences over time and surroundings; "Conversation awareness" automatically lowers the volume of what the user is listening to, reduces background noise, and improves voice audio if the user starts talking to someone nearby.{{cite web |title=iOS 17 |url=https://www.apple.com/ios/ios-17/ |website=Apple |access-date=4 November 2023}} ==Compatibility== Support for AirPods Pro was added in [[iOS 13|iOS 13.2]], [[watchOS]] 6.1, [[tvOS]] 13.2, and [[macOS Catalina]] 10.15.1. They are compatible with any device that supports [[Bluetooth]], including [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and [[Android (operating system)|Android]] devices, although certain features such as automatic switching between devices and single-AirPod listening {{Cite web |date= January 19, 2022|title=Do AirPods Work Well on Android Devices? |url=https://www.macrumors.com/guide/airpods-android/ |access-date= |website=MacRumors |language=en}} are only available on Apple devices using its [[iCloud]] service. {{AirPods technical specifications}} ==See also== * [[Apple headphones]] **[[EarPods]] **[[AirPods]] **[[AirPods Max]] * [[Google Pixel Buds]] * [[Samsung Galaxy Buds series|Samsung Galaxy Buds]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|https://www.apple.com/airpods-pro|AirPods Pro}} – official site {{Apple}} {{Apple hardware}} {{Apple hardware since 1998}} [[Category:Apple Inc. peripherals]] [[Category:iPhone accessories]] [[Category:Headphones]] [[Category:Products introduced in 2019]]
